newsitem.title: USA: US spot prods mixed after close, Gulf gasoline up.
newsitem.headline: US spot prods mixed after close, Gulf gasoline up.

text.p: U.S. spot products prices were mixed after the NYMEX close on Tuesday tracking futures, with differentials getting little lasting bounce from news of a fire Monday at Conoco's refinery in Lake Charles, La.
Conoco confirmed that a fire had broken out at its 180,000 barrel per day plant late Monday afternoon and that three people were injured, but said the incident had "no output impact."

But differentials on Gulf Coast M3-grade conventional unleaded gasoline did briefly firm about over 1.25 cents a gallon as traders covered their shorts upon the deadline for scheduling back-28th cycle material, traders said.

They later retreated to about 3.0 cents below the November print, still 0.65 firmer than Monday diffs. "But where are the buyers?" one Gulf trader asked, saying M3 sellers had gotten few nibbles after the morning flurry of buying.
New York reformulated A4-grade reformulated, meanwhile, remained about 0.25 cent above the November print.
"The switch to distillates is helping gasoline a lot," another Gulf trader said, adding heating oil supplies were becoming better offered.
Nevertheless, heating oil differentials were holding stable in both centers as November futures edged slightly lower.
The market awaited release later in the afternoon of new weekly API data, with traders predicting they will show a moderate gain in distillate stocks and a small rise in gasoline supplies.
-- Ransdell Pierson, New York Energy Desk 212 859-1632
